title: Marin Expands Alcatraz Collection Now With Two Builds – Suspension & Rigid
content:
Marin Mountain Bikes Inc has expanded the Alcatraz line of dirt jump mountain bikes. A modern mainstay of the Marin lineup, the model family grows from a single model and frameset to two different builds and an Alcatraz 2 frame kit.

The Alcatraz frames were designed in conjunction with Marin ambassador/MTB legend Matt Jones, and the Alcatraz 2 and 1 models utilize the same frames and are available in two sizes, short or long, with 385mm or 430mm reach measurements respectively. Both sizes have the same 69° headtube and seattube angles and 395mm chainstays. Key component differences between the two models include a Manitou Circus fork and Shimano hydraulic disc brakes on the Alcatraz 2, whereas the Alcatraz 1 is built around a suspension-corrected CrMo fork and Tektro mechanical disc brakes.

Alcatraz 2

Well-equipped with a dirt jump-specific fork, hydraulic brakes, and the best performance to price ratio.

• Series 3 Aluminum frame w/ 135x10mm horizontal dropouts, internal routing, 73mm threaded BB & ISCG05 tabs
• Manitou Circus Expert suspension fork w/ 100mm travel, coil spring
• Shimano MT201 hydraulic disc brakes
• MSRP $1399 (US), 1499€ (EU), £1299 (UK), $1899 (CAN)

Alcatraz 1

Perfect for pump tracks, smoother trails, or those looking to save a little cash. Built with the frame features as the Alcatraz 2 but with a suspension-corrected rigid fork, it’s a great starter point that can easily be upgraded as the rider progresses.

• Series 3 Aluminum frame w/ 135x10mm horizontal dropouts, internal routing, 73mm threaded BB & ISCG05 tabs
• Series 2 CrMo suspension-corrected fork w/100x9mm dropouts
• Tektro MD-M280 mechanical disc brakes
• MSRP $899 (US), 949€ (EU), £799 (UK), $1199 (CAN)

Alcatraz Frame Kit

Perfect for the rider looking to build up the dirt jumper of their dreams – or those looking to migrate components from their current DJ bike.
• Series 3 Aluminum frame w/ 135x10mm horizontal dropouts, internal routing, 73mm threaded BB & ISCG05 tabs
• Includes headset, chain tensioners & seat clamp
• MSRP $549(US), 559€ (EU), £495 (UK), $729 (CAN)

The new Alcatraz models will be available in global markets in the third quarter of 2024. Keep an eye out for a video from Miguel and his Race Metal series takes a turn to the pump track on a new Alcatraz!
